00009 #define GOSU_COPYRIGHT_NOTICE \

00019   "\n\n" \
00020   "[This is the first released version of the library GPL.  It is" \
00021   " numbered 2 because it goes with version 2 of the ordinary GPL.]" \
00022   "\n\n" \
00023   "             Preamble" \
00024   "\n\n" \
00025   "  The licenses for most software are designed to take away your" \
00026   "freedom to share and change it.  By contrast, the GNU General Public" \
00027   "Licenses are intended to guarantee your freedom to share and change" \
00028   "free software--to make sure the software is free for all its users." \
00029   "\n\n" \
00030   "  This license, the Library General Public License, applies to some" \
00031   "specially designated Free Software Foundation software, and to any" \
00032   "other libraries whose authors decide to use it.  You can use it for" \
00033   "your libraries, too." \
00034   "\n\n" \
00035   "  When we speak of free software, we are referring to freedom, not" \
00036   "price.  Our General Public Licenses are designed to make sure that you" \
00037   "have the freedom to distribute copies of free software (and charge for" \
00038   "this service if you wish), that you receive source code or can get it" \
00039   "if you want it, that you can change the software or use pieces of it" \
00040   "in new free programs; and that you know you can do these things." \
00041   "\n\n" \
00042   "  To protect your rights, we need to make restrictions that forbid" \
00043   "anyone to deny you these rights or to ask you to surrender the rights." \
00044   "These restrictions translate to certain responsibilities for you if" \
00045   "you distribute copies of the library, or if you modify it." \
00046   "\n\n" \
00047   "  For example, if you distribute copies of the library, whether gratis" \
00048   "or for a fee, you must give the recipients all the rights that we gave" \
00049   "you.  You must make sure that they, too, receive or can get the source" \
00050   "code.  If you link a program with the library, you must provide" \
00051   "complete object files to the recipients so that they can relink them" \
00052   "with the library, after making changes to the library and recompiling" \
00053   "it.  And you must show them these terms so they know their rights." \
00054   "\n\n" \
00055   "  Our method of protecting your rights has two steps: (1) copyright" \
00056   "the library, and (2) offer you this license which gives you legal" \
00057   "permission to copy, distribute and/or modify the library." \
00058   "\n\n" \
00059   "  Also, for each distributor's protection, we want to make certain" \
00060   "that everyone understands that there is no warranty for this free" \
00061   "library.  If the library is modified by someone else and passed on, we" \
00062   "want its recipients to know that what they have is not the original" \
00063   "version, so that any problems introduced by others will not reflect on" \
00064   "the original authors' reputations." \
00065   "" \
00066   "  Finally, any free program is threatened constantly by software" \
00067   "patents.  We wish to avoid the danger that companies distributing free" \
00068   "software will individually obtain patent licenses, thus in effect" \
00069   "transforming the program into proprietary software.  To prevent this," \
00070   "we have made it clear that any patent must be licensed for everyone's" \
00071   "free use or not licensed at all." \
00072   "\n\n" \
00073   "  Most GNU software, including some libraries, is covered by the ordinary" \
00074   "GNU General Public License, which was designed for utility programs.  This" \
00075   "license, the GNU Library General Public License, applies to certain" \
00076   "designated libraries.  This license is quite different from the ordinary" \
00077   "one; be sure to read it in full, and don't assume that anything in it is" \
00078   "the same as in the ordinary license." \
00079   "\n\n" \
00080   "  The reason we have a separate public license for some libraries is that" \
00081   "they blur the distinction we usually make between modifying or adding to a" \
00082   "program and simply using it.  Linking a program with a library, without" \
00083   "changing the library, is in some sense simply using the library, and is" \
00084   "analogous to running a utility program or application program.  However, in" \
00085   "a textual and legal sense, the linked executable is a combined work, a" \
00086   "derivative of the original library, and the ordinary General Public License" \
00087   "treats it as such." \
00088   "\n\n" \
00089   "  Because of this blurred distinction, using the ordinary General" \
00090   "Public License for libraries did not effectively promote software" \
00091   "sharing, because most developers did not use the libraries.  We" \
00092   "concluded that weaker conditions might promote sharing better." \
00093   "\n\n" \
00094   "  However, unrestricted linking of non-free programs would deprive the" \
00095   "users of those programs of all benefit from the free status of the" \
00096   "libraries themselves.  This Library General Public License is intended to" \
00097   "permit developers of non-free programs to use free libraries, while" \
00098   "preserving your freedom as a user of such programs to change the free" \
00099   "libraries that are incorporated in them.  (We have not seen how to achieve" \
00100   "this as regards changes in header files, but we have achieved it as regards" \
00101   "changes in the actual functions of the Library.)  The hope is that this" \
00102   "will lead to faster development of free libraries." \
00103   "\n\n" \
00104   "  The precise terms and conditions for copying, distribution and" \
00105   "modification follow.  Pay close attention to the difference between a" \
00106   "\n\n"work based on the library" and a "work that uses the library".  The" \
00107   "former contains code derived from the library, while the latter only" \
00108   "works together with the library." \
00109   "\n\n" \
00110   "  Note that it is possible for a library to be covered by the ordinary" \
00111   "General Public License rather than by this special one." \

00180   "\n\n" \
00181   "    (For example, a function in a library to compute square roots has" \
00182   "    a purpose that is entirely well-defined independent of the" \
00183   "    application.  Therefore, Subsection 2d requires that any" \
00184   "    application-supplied function or table used by this function must" \
00185   "    be optional: if the application does not supply it, the square" \
00186   "    root function must still compute square roots.)" \

00226   "derivative of it, under Section 2) in object code or executable form" \

00231   "\n\n" \

00235   "distribute the source code, even though third parties are not" \

00237   "\n\n" \
00238   "  5. A program that contains no derivative of any portion of the" \
00239   "Library, but is designed to work with the Library by being compiled or" \
00240   "linked with it, is called a "work that uses the Library".  Such a" \
00241   "work, in isolation, is not a derivative work of the Library, and" \
00242   "therefore falls outside the scope of this License." \
00243   "\n\n" \
00244   "  However, linking a "work that uses the Library" with the Library" \
00245   "creates an executable that is a derivative of the Library (because it" \
00246   "contains portions of the Library), rather than a "work that uses the" \
00247   "library".  The executable is therefore covered by this License." \
00248   "Section 6 states terms for distribution of such executables." \
00249   "\n\n" \
00250   "  When a "work that uses the Library" uses material from a header file" \
00251   "that is part of the Library, the object code for the work may be a" \
00252   "derivative work of the Library even though the source code is not." \
00253   "Whether this is true is especially significant if the work can be" \
00254   "linked without the Library, or if the work is itself a library.  The" \
00255   "threshold for this to be true is not precisely defined by law." \
00256   "\n\n" \
00257   "  If such an object file uses only numerical parameters, data" \
00258   "structure layouts and accessors, and small macros and small inline" \
00259   "functions (ten lines or less in length), then the use of the object" \
00260   "file is unrestricted, regardless of whether it is legally a derivative" \
00261   "work.  (Executables containing this object code plus portions of the" \
00262   "Library will still fall under Section 6.)" \
00263   "\n\n" \
00264   "  Otherwise, if the work is a derivative of the Library, you may" \
00265   "distribute the object code for the work under the terms of Section 6." \
00266   "Any executables containing that work also fall under Section 6," \
